name: GetUserAuditRecords
description:
Retrieve audit records for a specified user from Pagerduty.

This tool fetches audit records related to specific changes made to a user in Pagerduty. The records are sorted by execution time and provide insights into user-related changes. Use this tool when you need to review or audit user modifications. It requires appropriate OAuth permissions.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the user whose audit records you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the API response. Use it to ensure compatibility with the expected API output format.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify the media type of the request. Should be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Defines the maximum number of audit records to retrieve per request. The request will return up to this number of records, or fewer if the result set is smaller.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: next_results_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for the next set of results. Use the `next_cursor` from the previous request to continue paging.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for the audit record search. Defaults to 24 hours ago if not specified.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Specify the end date for the search range. Defaults to now; cannot exceed 31 days beyond the 'since' date.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
